intro: Hedyotis wynaadensis, commonly known as the Wynaad shrub, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
